intro: Joannesia heveoides, commonly known as the rubber vine, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a climbing shrub that belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, greenish flowers. It produces a milky sap that contains latex, similar to rubber trees. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
